Great work on the game, came back to it after a year or so, much more polished and offers a very complete experience at the moment. Would recommend to anyone who likes base building games managing resources and surviving enemy waves. Some caveats are that the game is not completely finished, there are some bugs with bridges that prevent certain events such as military and merchant to not activate because they are stuck on the other side of the bridge. Given that the game can be played on the world map allowing players to pick from any place to start, i imagine there is a lot of work that needs to be done but very playable state right now.

I do have, however, a few suggestions for the game mechanics wise:
1. allow for worker locking for every building ex: lock my barns to be 18/18 so when i select 0 on the general managing tab, they do not get removed so i dont need to micromanage as much for specific high priority production that i would never want out, same thing with all the other production buildings as well as kindergarden, hospitals, etc. 
2. allow priority for building and scavenging mechanics so players can be more specific in managing buildings and scavenging without having to micromanage too much.
3. allow a guard feature for squads where they can protect a certain object, ex: when recovering damaged cars they move slow so other squads can guard them. perhaps add a field repair kit for cars, maybe this will be too strong for the game mechanics wise so this is more dependent on game balance.
4. similar to suggestion 1, when i hover over a specific area such as farming, add the option to display more details, how many are on farming, how many are on barns, how how many are planting trees, how many are in the planting tree building etc. (maybe not by default, but add the option so players can use this later, toggle to display more detail by default with the option to change this in the settings to toggle to display basic info
5. more options available for when selecting multiple squads to act. Ex: which squad goes in first, second, third, etc when clearing out buildings, help with lairs clearing and enable drive in sync, faster cars will drive together with the slower car
6. outline pathing for guards, which route they have to take to reach the towers so players can place the towers so that guards don't go outside the base and swim across water to go in
7. lategame, add a function to manage where citizens can come home before the night arrives, there is a common problem i find when i get to the ultra late game that citizens are going very far to break apart buildings for resources and they die on the way back because its too far away (same thing with building proxy walls)
8. add the options to area select broken or damaged buildings and repair only those buildings in addition to the repair all option only (late game when i have same wall type close and far away from base i want the ones closer to my base to be repaired first)
9. add a supply of metal other than buildings and natural resources, this is the only thing preventing a self sustaining base, which is good to add from a player perspective, we can feel we "conquered an area" fully

for devs: these suggestions are ordered as close to importance to my personal game experience as possible, the game is still in development but it is already looking much better than before and a game that i would recommend in the current state. despite this, there are many optimisations that could be done for player experience from a resource management perspective that would solve a lot of micromanaging problems that players may encounter when having a bigger population. this is the only reason why i would not be too motivated to keep replaying different maps because the micromanaging late game is too tiresome but necessary when playing on harder difficulties

The concept of the game is made with quality. It‚Äôs a perfect game for the Tower Defense and base-building genre. I hope the game will continue to improve and get updates. There are no real downsides to the game itself, since the overall concept is done perfectly. But I do have a few suggestions that could make the game even better:

1. Add the ability to build infinite resource mines for a more casual experience.
Right now, the metal resources on the map run out and it becomes impossible to gather them anymore. As a result, after some time it becomes unplayable. Bricks are currently produced through a special building, but after a while its production reserves run out and the building stops working - and you can‚Äôt demolish it. It would be great to have a system like in Banished, where you can make it so the resources in those buildings don‚Äôt run out. Many players would probably enjoy that option. After all, the main goal of any game is to have fun and adding this feature would only expand the game‚Äôs audience.

2. Make it so that eventually the game forces you to lose to massive zombie hordes.
Right now, by the end of the game you already have a powerful base, and although the zombie hordes become stronger, they still don‚Äôt pose much of a threat. It would be great if surviving became harder and harder over time. That way there would be a real goal - to build a strong base and push your limits. At the moment, once you have a powerful base, there‚Äôs simply nothing to do since there‚Äôs no real danger anymore.

3. More content additions.
I‚Äôll just leave this point for adding more content - things like more types of food, weapons, defensive structures, etc. Of course, the developers will know best what can be added without breaking the balance.

4. Add more functionality for workers.
For example, it would be great if certain workers assigned to specific tasks could automatically head home at a set time. Sometimes workers are dismantling a building far from the base and finish work late in the evening, when zombies are already appearing. They have to walk a long way back, and often get killed on the way. It would help if workers avoided that situation automatically.

5. Fix the bandit AI.
It‚Äôs strange to see a group of five bandits armed with knives charging straight into the base, getting shot dozens of times and dying instantly. Bandit attacks should feel more organized and large-scale.

6. Random events.
It would be really interesting to add random events that can happen to your base - for example, a riot, disease outbreak, bad harvest season, supply drop, and so on. That would make the gameplay more varied and less repetitive.

Starting with the pros.

2. Vehicle customization.

3. The Storyline. 
I really enjoy games that have a great story that will suck you in. At first, the game was a little slow, and I thought that I wasn't going to like it. However, once I found Miller, I got sucked right in, and I haven't been able to stop playing these last few days. 

Honorable Mentions.
I played the 911 Operator game. It was a nice touch from the devs to have the character be the same voice actor from that game, voice this game's main character. And the subtle Easter Egg, pointing to that when talking to Miller.  

Now, let's go over the cons. 
1. Resource Scarcity.
Resources are plentiful right at the beginning of the game; however, just like real life, after a while, they dwindle to nothing. My community is around 500 people, and it's hard to keep food on the table. I've had to activate the console command and add food to the HQ multiple times because there is nothing left around me. The same goes for materials. Yes, the trader comes around once in a while, but he doesn't have nearly enough food/materials that I need for my community. Those units are still on my map today because there is no delete item (whether it be squads or vehicles) command in the console. Which leads me to number three, 

3. Cluttered map. 
I am currently on the Find the Purifier's Leader mission. I wanted to just search for him, instead of trying to triangulate the signal. Still you can keep them going around the clock and the only thing stopping you from doing that would be zombies running around during the night (and attacking your safety area).

The gameplay initially is ok. You go out and try to find urgently needed resources (more and better weapons, protection, medicine, food and some other things. So scavenging early on is more about finding the few specialized buildings where you have specific resources in higher numbers. Use those materials to make my scavenging team better while the workers just try to collect what ever they can find and build some shabby defenses and shelters for survival.

The base building will always be an ongoing process as it is always about new building and more of them. The problem with that is that it is a painfully slow process and messy in terms of menus and handling. Overall you make a plan for defenses, shelter and production and then you just wait while you click through some occasional minor story lines and instruct the scavenger team to go to the next grid.

After a while it then also includes areas outside your central map. Unfortunately the exploration also becomes very tedious. You end up just a hand ful of items you get with every search. Rarely are there any surprises. The story is not engaging enough to keep me invested. You have the typical troped that are being played out,

It's a bit of a shame...
